Issues.Title: Fix a few more ref counts in ActiveXImpl
Issues.Body:
This is the last audit change of `ActiveXImpl`. Changes were vetted against docs and MFC implementations.

- `QuickActivate`` was releasing pointers it shouldn't have been.
- `SetAdvise` and `GetAdvise` were not AddRef'ing appropriately.
- Update comments.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9634)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix a few more ref counts in ActiveXImpl" (#9634)

Issues.Title: ActiveXImpl.QuickActivate has a dependency on COM interop IConnectionPointContainer
Issues.Body:
[The code here](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/c0ac1f1723e6cd67563d0c979842ae3c1609fd44/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/Control.ActiveXImpl.cs#L1412) leverages the auto-generated `IConnectionPointContainer` from COM interop. If built-in COM interop is not available we'll have to figure how to replace this.

In this particular case it is only done for user controls, but we probably will need to provide this functionality in general for Control. I'm not sure how prevalent this is for our users that would want to use AOT.

cc: @AaronRobinsonMSFT @lonitra
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ActiveXImpl.QuickActivate has a dependency on COM interop IConnectionPointContainer" (#9633)

Issues.Title: Use AdviseHolder in ActiveXImpl
Issues.Body:
This change is the first of a series that is auditing and documenting our ActiveX control usages.

Our handling of Advise/Unadvise wasn't properly ref counting. MFC just uses the Windows provided IOleAdviseHolder, this change does the same.

This change also adds a number of inheritdoc tags to pick up the documentation generated by CSWin32, Note that the interface names don't always match as the documentation is only on the base interface.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9632)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use AdviseHolder in ActiveXImpl" (#9632)

Issues.Title: Designer adds/removes whitespaces in code file needlessly
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2022 (64-bit) - Version 17.6.2

### .NET version

.NET 7

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

There was no problem when I was using Visual Studio 2017. However, Resharper was available with VS2017.

### Issue description

I was using VS2017 previously with Resharper. I started to use VS2022 without Resharper now...
I noticed that, whenever I perform a modification on designer, it adds/removes whitespace characters on several lines in the code file. Some examples are below. They are needless. It causes a modification in code file eventhough I didn't. I revert them one by one...

Examples:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/106665359/d9fb634c-7524-46d0-bf43-30a236f813c2)

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/106665359/de5f0345-0f83-45e6-99b0-4ef8f303c3aa)



### Steps to reproduce

- Create a form. Fill the Load event code similar to below. Be careful with the whitespace usage between **(double)** and **x**.
```
private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
      int x = 4;
      var y = (double) x;
}
```
- Open designer, do some modification
- Return back to code. Notice that, whitespace is removed. Designer modified the code.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Designer adds/removes whitespaces in code file needlessly" (#9625)

Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9596
## Issue description
When  PrintPreviewControl is created and the handle is created, then change the size of the PrintPreviewControl to a very little size ,for example (0,0) , an exception will be thrown.

## Proposed changes

- Add parameter check before throwing Exception

## Proposed changes

- Add file_header_template to .editorconfig file for .cs and .vb files
- Change all cs and vb files to use 2-line header

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

Issues.Title: TabControl with Appearance=Normal renders TabPage within a littlebit incorrect rectangle
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

On image you see white color borders that belong to TabControl. Widthes are different: top and right 1px, bottom 2 px, left 3 px. You don't see these borders if you use default transparent color of TabPage. But if you use another color, you see its. This difference of widthes creates impression of some kind of incompleteness of application.

![TabControl](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/45461294/e1abf6c5-9125-4716-af0b-ccea8e70da7b)


### Steps to reproduce

See it in Designer.

.NET Framework has it too.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TabControl with Appearance=Normal renders TabPage within a littlebit incorrect rectangle" (#9612)

Issues.Title: Enable nullability in several UITypeEditors
Issues.Body:
Those should be straightforward.

## Proposed changes

- Enable nullability in `ShortcutKeysEditor`
- Enable nullability in `DateTimeEditor`
- Enable nullability in `MaskedTextBoxTextEditor`
